remarks: Define polarity of projective subspace, which is a kind of complement of the subspace.  Item 2 in [Holland95] p. 222 bottom.  For more generality, we define it for all subsets of atoms, not just projective subspaces.  The intersection with ` Atoms `` l ` ensures it is defined when ` m = (/) ` .
